snippet: Attacks in Bangui have reached “unprecedented levels” with at least 30 people killed in the past three days, humanitarian officials said.
abstract: Red Cross officials say violence in Central African Republic's capital Bangui has reached unprecedented levels, with at least thirty people killed in three days as heavily armed rebels regroup in nearby town.
lead_paragraph: Attacks in Bangui have reached “unprecedented levels” with at least 30 people killed in the past three days, humanitarian officials said.

headline.main: Violence in Central African Republic’s Capital Alarms Red Cross
headline.print_headline: Violence in Central African Republic’s Capital Alarms Red Cross
